keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, with the final beating in the infirmary resulting in his death.
The body-camera footage, though silent, captured guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, showing a lack of concern and contributing significantly to the prosecution's case.
David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter; Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder and first-degree manslaughter.
Kieffer and Galliher were charged with second-degree gang assault but acquitted; Kieffer also faced a charge of filing a false instrument, which was not pursued.
Defense attorneys argued that the guards were not individually responsible for the violence committed by others, asserting lack of intent or direct participation.
Prosecutor William Fitzpatrick alleged that all guards acted as a gang and showed depraved indifference to human life, supporting murder charges.
Brooks had been serving a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault since 2017 and was transferred to Marcy Correctional Facility that night.

Six of the 10 guards indicted in February were charged with murder; five had previously pleaded guilty to manslaughter, and one pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor charge of attempted tampering with physical evidence.
Three more guards have agreed to plead guilty to reduced charges and are cooperating with prosecutors.

William Fitzpatrick, as special prosecutor, also oversees a separate case involving the death of Messiah Nantwi in March 2025 at Mid-State Correctional Facility, indicating a pattern of misconduct in prison operations.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York state prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the death of inmate Robert Brooks, who was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The incident was captured on silent body-camera footage showing guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, with the final beating in the infirmary causing fatal internal injuries. Two other guards, Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer, were acquitted of murder charges despite involvement in the violence; Kieffer was also charged with false instrument and gang assault, both of which were not proven. The prosecution, led by special prosecutor William Fitzpatrick, argued that all guards acted as a gang with depraved indifference to human life. The case is part of a broader pattern of prison violence, including a separate incident involving inmate Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility, which is also under investigation. Several guards have pleaded guilty to lesser charges or are cooperating, and the legal actions reflect ongoing efforts to hold correctional officers accountable for misconduct.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, Two Others Acquitted
